newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Sri Lanka refinery Jan shutdown to prompt imports.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka refinery Jan shutdown to prompt imports.

text.p: Sri Lanka's state-owned Ceylon Petroleum Corp (CPC) will seek more oil products when it shuts down its 50,000-to-60,000-barrel-per-day (bpd) refinery from mid-January, a company official said on Wednesday.
The refinery will undergo maintenance for one and a half months.
"We will have a complete shutdown," the official said. "So we will be short of product and will emerge to buy more by tender either in second-half December or first-half January."
Already short of middle distillates, CPC usually buys one to two combination cargoes of around 160,000 barrels of 1.0-percent sulphur diesel and 40,000 barrels of aviation jet fuel a month.
The official said the country's only refinery at Sapugaskanda had its last maintenance shutdown in January-February 1995.
